1: Cats can't actually see laser dots very well, but they love chasing the movement! Their predatory instincts kick in when they see something small and fast moving.
2: Cats have retractable claws, which means they can curl their claws up into their paws when they're not using them. This helps them to walk quietly and silently.
3: Cats have a keen sense of hearing and can hear sounds as high as 65,000 Hz, which is much higher than what humans can hear.
4: Cats have a third eyelid, which is a clear membrane that covers the eye and helps to keep it moist and protected.
5: Cats have a natural instinct to hunt and catch prey, which is why they are so good at chasing and catching small animals.
